node.descriptionHTML: • Changed to fixed bootstrap version in package.json due to a breaking change in Bootstrap 4.4.0 regarding the responsiveness of the container class.
• Changed to a fixed bootstrap version in package.json due to a breaking change in Bootstrap 4.4.0 regarding the responsiveness of the container class.

Features

  • (#917) (#920)(#931)(#936) Added new icons
  • (#918) Added checkmark animation
  • (#934) Add new hover classes for links. link-dark and link-transition
  • (#939) New animation for sublime attention (growing circle)
  • (#952) Changed small and stacked radio-card animations to box-shadow from border

Bugfixes

  • (#915) The attached file should now display file name in IE11 again
  • (#946) Fixed alignment of radio buttons inside stacked and small cards

Documentation

  • (#944) Added example of how to do risk rating with already existing classes.
  • (#955) Slider component should now look good in Edge too
  • (#950) checkboxes will no be visible inside dropdown if you use flex on li
  • (#955) Slider component should now look ok in Edge
• Removed console.log from custom select file
• Fixed a IE11 bug in custom file upload

Features

  • (#888) Bootstrap is now updated to 4.3.1.
  • (#895 ) New component Timeline.
  • (#876) Updated Jquery to 3.4.
  • (#881) New design for radio and checkboxes
  • (#901) Nav component now has a small version .nav-small.
  • (#902) New Sass variable for #fafafa $alabaster .
  • (#903) New icon for Print.
  • (#897) (#892) New icons

Bugfixes

  • (#887) Btn-link should now be able to display ÅÄÖ on android phones.
  • (#912) Custom dropdown will now work with dynamically added items

Features

  • (#797) (#794) (#815) (#831) (#827) (#832) (#816) (#857) (#860) Added new icons
  • (#790) New component - Upload
  • (#806) Extend Radio cards with a small version
  • (#833) Add example of radio card small without icon
  • (#846) change animation - upload component
  • (#843) added new modifier btn-tight for less padding inside buttons

Bugfixes

  • (#793) Exception for btn-link inside clickable table
  • (#804) Long text in Radio card's will now break as intended
  • (#809) Custom multi select will now be triggerd from label too
  • (#800) Btn-primary will now have focus state in Safari
  • (#808) progress-container-vertical text overflow in IE
  • (#822) Update moment.js to pass npm audit
  • (#854) Read more button - decreased spacing between icon and text
  • (#855) Removed border from btn-more
  • (#874) Added focus state to custom file upload
  • (#864) Custom file - label will now be cleared when selection is
  • (#838 ) Label not being updated on file upload in file upload form element

Documentation

  • (#844 ) Avatar removed versions
  • (#843) Add documentation how to use bankID icon
  • (#845) Update collapse with example with background
Update moment.js verrsion to pass npm audit for GARANT Grundplus

Included in this release is a small number of fixes mostly regarding accessibility for Öppna Sidorna and new design for autocomplete search.

Summary

Breaking:
(#748)Custom forms(radio, checkbox, switch) does not have built-in right margin anymore. You now have to use modifier classes like .ml-05 to achieve desired spacing.

Features

(#751) An updated design for autocomplete search.
(#753) Support for another level in custom selects
(#765) added gravestone-32 icon
(#778) Support to pick time in datepicker

Changes

(#748)Custom forms(radio, checkbox, switch) does not have built-in right margin anymore.

Bugfixes

(#748) Radio, switch and checkboxes spacing
(#770) Custom dropdown focus behavior on first and last link
(#767) Datepicker height issue in chrome
(#775) Custom multi-select broken underline when long text in option
(#777) Progress circle moshing if in small containers
(#774) Custom multi-select keyboard behavior

Documentation

(#760) Removed dropdown from the documentation. It's old and should not be used. Code is still available for projects already using it.
(#773) Added information about browser differences regarding focus state on tab without any screen reader in use.
(#776) Added information about Headings inside alerts.
(#786) Updated keyboard navigation for custom radio inputs to behave as normal radio buttons.

Summary of changes

LFUI is now upgraded to use the sharp version Bootstrap 4. The change list from the Bootstrap community can be found here -> Beta 3 Ship list, Beta 2 Ship list, Beta 1 Ship list and Alpha 6 Ship list. Also check the migration instructions here

This is a summary page for all changes that will ship together with v6.0.0. Some of the changes are copied from Bootstrap migration list.

Browser support

  • Dropped IE8, IE9, and iOS 6 support. v4 is now only IE10+ and iOS 7+. For sites needing either of those, use v3.

Summary

  • Breaking: The xs breakpoint in the grid system no longer requires an infix. This means that col-xs-* can be replaced with col-*.
  • Breaking: Rename .tag to .badge to avoid conflicting with WordPress
  • Renamed _animation.scss to _transitions_scss.
  • Flexbox is now the default display property. This means LFUI does not support IE9.
  • Breaking: Because of flexbox the modal-footer is now using justify-content: flex-end. All the buttons in the modal-footer now need to be in the viewing order in the DOM.
  • The transitioning class for components toggled via JavaScript is .show instead of "in"/“active”.
  • All Vertical Link lists using nav class now needs the class .flex-column to get stacked vertically.
  • Breaking: Nearly all .hidden-* classes are removed and replaced with display utilities .d-*. More information can be found at Display property. We also added d-*-table-row.
  • Breaking: Checkboxes, switch and radios has new markup to make it simpler. Less markup and more use of pseudo-elements and now, both have matching HTML structure. Note that the custom multi select needs some modification to follow the new checkbox markup.
  • Breaking: .col-form-legend is removed and replaced with .col-form-label.
  • Custom file inputs received a change to their $custom-file-text Sass variable. It's no longer a nested Sass map and now only powers one string—the Browse button as that is now the only pseudo-element generated from our Sass. The Choose file text now comes from the .custom-file-label.
  • Breaking: .input-group-btn and .input-group-addon is gone. Use the two new classes, .input-group-append and .input-group-prepend. You also need to surround your text with input-group-text. See the examples in the documentation.
  • Breaking: .input-group-addon-img is replaced with input-group-prepend-img.
  • Sizing classes must be on the parent .input-group and not the individual form elements.
  • Added space to the buttons for the spinner. The spinner now pushes the text a bit and then shows the spinner. Also added a section in the documentation where the loader can be tested. No new markup is needed for using this.
  • Breaking: The datepicker is patched to work with the new bootstrap 4 version. Use input-group-append for the icon instead of input-group-addon input-group-btn.
  • See the new button with loader section. The loader with two lines may need some changes depending on how you have implemented it. Wrap the lines with an inline-block div element. This makes the spinner positioned correctly.
  • Breaking: Changed icon names. See pull request #711
    dot-40 -> radio-enclosed-40
    envelop-40 -> letter-40
    first-aid-40 -> breiefcase-first-aid-40
    note-40 -> clipboard-40
    navigation-phone-40 -> phone-40

Features

  • (#724) Added progress indicator with steps. Examples here
  • (#723) Shortcuts with two lines. Also added class for disabled shortcuts. Examples here
  • (#742) There is now an option to add blue background on hover.

Changes

  • (f0faf54) The @drop-arrow-mixin now only takes in 5 arguments instead of 6.
  • (#667) Button with spinner is modified. The spinner now pushes the text a bit and then the spinner is shown. The button is now not that jumpy as it was before.
  • (#665) Changed the scss for datepicker. It should now work with form-inline.
  • (#680) (#682) Bumped up datepicker version to a new version with bootstrap 4 support.
  • (#688) Added min-height to the cards. The cards now have a min-height that is 4rem.
  • (#719) It's now possible to use two lined shorcuts with icons.
  • (#728 ) Added disabled class to input-group

Bugfixes

  • (c9f85db) Reset border radius on all buttons. Fixes issue where buttons in Chrome v62 had border-radius.
  • (#654) Classlist is not supported in IE. Use jquery when adding/removing classes for the graphs.
  • (#658) Added a section for the trouble of the problem that we found at lf.se. Issue (#657)
  • (#674) Added a min-width for the datepicker. It should never be smaller than 336 px.
  • (#679) fixed btn-link bug where the button was not aligned. Also fixed the problem where the underline was misplaced.
  • (#639) It's now possible to override $asset-path i the variables. Added a default flag to the variable.
  • (#689) The chevron for .btn-more got more width. The chevron now fits perfectly after the text.
  • (#694) Fixed the animation in the blue and red spinner. There was a typo in the css that affected Chrome and Safari.
  • (#695) Changed the fill-color on some of the icons. The icons should always have #FF0000 as a fill color. This makes it possible to use currentColor when using the icons.
  • (#698) Fixed problem with missing underline when using btn-link in combination with btn-block. See how to fix it in your application here (#698).
  • (#705) Fixed problem with duplicated values added to the value list in custom multi select. Rewrote the component.
  • (#709) Removed faulty css in pie-chart.scss that added a white border in the middle of the chart.
  • (#708) Removed the padding on fixed-top navbars.
  • (#710) Added font: inherit on buttons in <th>
  • (#707) Removed the min-width on the login buttons.
  • (#706) Added pointer to all role=buttons
  • (#730) Fixed button styling for btns with data-no-expand attribute.
  • (#732) Value box chevron not flipping on expand
  • (#733) Table heading should be h6
  • (#734) Z-index in table-row
  • (#735) Chrome (retina) render grey line over links at some zoom levels.
  • (#642) btn group jumpy

Documentation

  • (#612) Patch/documentation fixes
  • (#656) Buttons pages are now split into several subpages.
  • (#662) Fixed bug where search field was not hidden in the mobile view.
  • (#663) Removed unused page form-errorMessages.
  • (#675) Fixed the type in the color table for btn-outline-info.
  • (#676) Removed the graph colors that was defined on the colors page. Now linking to graphs and charts page instead
  • (d6d1a4b) .col-form-legend replaced with .col-form-label
  • (#684 ) Changed the two lined buttons on the example page.
  • (36bc12d) Added new section for loaders. Now you can test them in the style guide.
  • (#685) Fixed broken release page. New API token added.
  • (#690) Added more examples on the focus page.
  • (#697) Changed all bootstrap alpha links to getbootstrap.com
  • (#702) The active class is now only added to radio button change event
  • (#744) Added rgb values to color tiles.

Tests

  • (6f6b75a) Slider baseline updated
  • (4296350) Links baseline updated
  • (e346e21) Köptjänster examples baseline updated
  • (0bda330) Input group baseline updated
  • (b4ab23e) Datepicker baseline updated
  • (59e6d24 ) Custom select baseline updated
  • (1d5387c) Custom forms baseline updated
  • (0e0e21f) Alerts baseline updated
  • (8626222) (519ac86) Added possibility to rebase or run a single test file. Use script test-component and test-rebase-component.

Packaging

  • (#602) Patch/webpack
    • Updated webpack version from 1 to 3.
    • Updated and reformatted syntax in all three webpack config files.
    • Updated and cleaned up dependencies.
    • Removed unused .postcss.js file.
    • Removed long-since deprecated icons ⚠️ .
    • Our Scss import problem with tildes (~) is now handled by postcss plugin instead of omit-tilde-webpack-plugin)
  • (#597) Added Intellij files to gitignore
  • (#599) Patch/visual reg test mismatch tolerance
    • (#601) Mismatch tolerance changed to 0
  • (#600) Updated postcss-base64 module to avoid fs module in the project
  • (#711) Some of the old icons are deprecated. See the icon page to see exactly the deprecated icons.

This is small release based on the 5.2.2 release, mainly intended for Öppna Sidorna, containing new icons for the mega menu.

Summary of changes

Features

  • (5f2049b) (aa0d77e) New mega menu icons added.
    • about_LF
    • accont-32
    • apply_job-32
    • contact-32
    • digital_services-32
    • economy-32
    • finance-32
    • forms-32
    • insurance-32
    • insurance_vehicle-32
    • investment-32
    • loan-32
    • offer-32
    • press_media-32
    • prevent-32
    • subsidiaries-32
    • sustainability-32
    • save_profile-32
    • insurance_truck-32
    • bank-32

LFUI 5.4.0

Included in this version of LFUI is a refactored version of the custom select component, and mostly bug fixes for Internet Explorer. If you are using LFUI 5.3.0 in your application this upgrade should be kind of easy to upgrade to.

Note that you don't need to upgrade to this version if you don't want to use the refactored custom select. There will be a major release soon with Bootstrap beta bump, thus it's better to upgrade to that version.

If you feel unsure on how to update your dependency, check out the README.

Coming up...

Guess what? We are working on upgrading to the latest Bootstrap beta version. The shipping list for this can be found here #593.

Summary of changes

This is a summary page for all changes that will ship together with v5.4.0

Features

  • (#636) Rebuilt and extended custom select component and functionality, see documentation for details
    • Added support for "searching" after options in the custom select by typing.
    • Added support for multiple select.
    • Added support for option group headers for categorizing options.
  • (#646) CSS added to make jQuery UI slider with two range-thumbs work with LFUI style. See the documentation for details.
  • (#647) Added support for sub anchor linking in the documentation. It's now possible to send
  • (#650) The search field in the header in the styleguide is a bit smarter now. When using the search function you can search for headers on the component pages. e.g when searching for warning you will get results for the pages buttons and alerts.

Bugfixes

  • (#606) Fixed bug where pagination had blue borders
  • (#610) Changed the color to always $black for custom-controls when the validation class is added.
  • (#617) Breadcrumb alignment fixed in ie11
  • (c9f85db) Reset border radius on all buttons. Fixes issue where buttons in Chrome v62 had border radius.
  • (#624) Fixed issue where input fields were 38px instead of 40px in IE.
  • (#622) Fixed bug where arrows in btn-link-left variants moved the wrong way in IE.
  • (#625) Fixed issue where slider labels were wrongly positioned in IE
  • (#626) Fixed issue where search icon was missing in IE
  • (#659) Removed code that made the history break when using the search field in the header.

Documentation

  • (#609) Updated example documentation for btn-group-stretch
  • (ac28a7a) Added feature to pie charts to interact by clicking on slices. Changed the styling of graph help text.
  • (8e41b4b) Fixed issue where icon_flag.svg was not exported in styleguide build
  • (#619) Fixed html example of price-box-bottom to work better in smaller screens
  • (#648) (#651) Updated the router to react-router-dom. Made some changes in the router structure to make it work with the new dependency. We can now use {{baseUrl}} in the md-files when linking to pages in the style guide. {{baseUrl}} will be replaced with the current url. Also added support for sub anchor linking. It's possible to link to a specific section on a page.
  • (#650) The search field in the header is now a bit smarter. It can actually find headers in the MD files and present them as items in the search dropdown. It's also possible to add keywords to the pages. Right now it's only one of the pages that are using this feature. Alerts = Fiskpinne / Glasspinne.
  • (#640) All input fields on forms page now have the has-valid class when they are not empty.
  • (33a1818) Updated the icon used in documentation for external links.

Packaging

  • (#607) Patch/mismatch tolerence
  • (#608) Updated postcss-base64 module to avoid fs module in the project

LFUI 5.3.0 is here!

Included in this release is a multitude of changes, all of which you can read more about in the summary below.

If you feel unsure on how to update your dependency, check out the README.

First off, do note that LFUI still hasn't updated its Boostrap v4-alpha dependency and thus still relies on alpha-5. Because of this, it is important that you respect that the official bootstrap documentation is currently not 100% compatible with our version.

Bootstrap v4 has finally reached a stable Beta release. Thus, the next LFUI release will be a major release where we're looking to update the Bootstrap dependency, finally.

You can view the styleguide here

Highlighted changes and new components

These are changes that will require your immediate attention when updating from 5.2.x to 5.3.0:

  • LFUI now natively positions all arrows and spinners within any type of .btn vertically centered. This means that buttons with more than one row of text (a common new pattern, take a look at the Buttons page for examples) can be expanded in height without any sweat.
  • The Header and Footer components' links have been updated, using a new link class .link-complex-adaptive-target to achieve proper behavior. You will need to update your HTML to get this styling for free.
  • The assets previously located in dist/ have been moved. Now the correct path is dist/assets/svg/. This might cause some trouble if you're currently fetching red-corner.svg from the old path, and the path should be updated to match the new one. Here you can now also find the logos for the different Länsbolag!
  • _variables.scss has been reformatted. All variables from the components' scss files have been moved into it, as per Bootstrap scemantics. Unused variables have also been cleaned up and removed... Which might cause missing variable problems in your applications, should you be relying on older variables that are not being used in LFUI any more.
  • The javascript code for our Custom Select component has received an update. It now includes better keyboard support, automatic detection whether to appear on top or bottom of input, as well as maximum number of options visible at once. Make sure you update your local javascript code to this, you can find it in Forms - Custom.
  • The chevron icons have all been updated. Together with this, the chevron in the price-box-bottom component of Price Box also got itself a fix where it previously did not render correctly in Firefox. This will require an HTML update on your part, however, or else it will render two sets of chevrons. Check out the updated example in the link above, where you can see we've removed the <svg> element. You should do this as well.
  • Our Radio Cards have been updated and received a new appearance, which you can see at Forms - Custom. This should not require a change in your html - unless you have buttons positioned inside the cards. These have new responsive behavior, which you can preview by resizing the window at the link above. You should update your Radio Cards to match these.
  • The pagination variants .pagination-progress, .pagination-color and .pagination-steps have been deprecated. Take a look at the Pagination page and make sure you have the correct pagination component in your application as the other, deprecated variations will be removed in coming LFUI releases.
  • "Plus"-characters in buttons (such as a button with the content "+ Lägg till") should now utilize the plus-10-icon instead of a "+" character.

New components

  • A Slider component has been added, utilizing the native input[type="range"] HTML element.
  • LFUI now contains examples and guides on how to code and style Graphs and Charts. LFUI suggests using the powerful library D3.js for this. Read all about it and view the examples at the link.
  • A whole bunch of new icons have been added, which can be viewed in Icons. They are:
    • circeldiagram-40
    • computer-40
    • cup-40
    • id-40
    • sustainability-40
    • user-happy-32
    • plus-10
    • contact-header-24
  • Icon positioning utility classes have been added to make sure they are properly used together with and inside other components. Read more about them in the Icon page.
  • A grey diagonal stripes pattern has been added, you can view it under Patterns and/or Colors.

Styleguide features

  • LFUI development now includes CSS regression tests, which you can read more about here. The tests are in place in order to increase security in development of LFUI and try to make sure no breaking css changes are shipped together with releases.
  • Example pages have been added.
    • A button example which simply lists each and every variation of our buttons. This is mainly for css regression testing purposes.
    • A Köptjänst Example. This example is derived from the Köptjänst Motor prototype, and is meant to give an example on how LFUI is applied and used when building full pages.

Coming up...

As stated above, the next LFUI release is planned to update the Bootstrap v4 dependency from alpha-5 to beta. This will be tagged as a major release (6.0.0), as the changes will be breaking. Bootstrap has changed several classes and components and functionality across the entire framework, which will require us to spend much time to update our affected components.

Summary of changes

This is a summary page for all changes that will ship together with v5.3.0

Features

  • (#553) Added CSS visual regression tests
  • (#558) Fixed faulty tests of custom-forms, datepicker, popover-tooltp, header.
  • (#554) Added slider component
    • (#592) Slider component now supports labels.
  • (#534) Added new icons (user-happy-32, plus-10, contact-header-24) and improved chevron-32, disted icons and js
  • (#587) Added new OS icons. Disted.
    • icons: circeldiagram-40, computer-40, cup-40, id-40, sustainability-40
  • (#528) Adjusted colors of bg-diagonal-stripes-gray
  • (c2e8269) Added a new link type: link-complex-adaptive-target, used in header and footer component.
  • (#563) Added mixins for distibution-bar value styling
  • (#570) Feature/examples
    • Adds two examples to the 'examples' page. 'Köptjänst example' is the main one, which reproduces the prototype of the 'köptjänst motor' flow. The other is button examples, which simply renders our each and every button variation we have, mainly for testing purposes.
    • Adds visual regression testing to example modules.
  • (#573) Feature/d3 graphical components
    • This feature adds a new component page 'D3 Graphs & Charts', containing instructions and examples on how to work with D3 to achieve LFUI-approved graphs and charts.
    • D3 is now imported from CDN in index.html of the styleguide.

Changes

  • (#531) Due to the datepicker dependency having a BS3 dependency, I forked, cloned and removed the dependency from the module. Changed datepicker to my forked version in package.json.
  • (#536) Added support for btns with more than one line together with arrows.
  • (#538) Updated chevron icons, replaced old ones, disted.
  • (#539) Added logotypes of LF companies. Fixed asset structure
    • Breaking: Svg assets previously reachable in dist/ have now been moved into dist/assets/svg. red-corner.svg might give this error.
  • (#544) Patch/header and footer links.
    • Note: Restructured html and scss of the links in header and footer component. To have the correct styling and behavior, your html will have to be updated. Take a look at the example page.
  • (#546) Custom-select - Improved keyboard interaction, automatic positioning top and bottom, resize of menu length if no space.
    • Note: The script has been updated, and you will have to update it manually in your local files. Copy/paste the updated code from the Forms - Custom example page.
  • (#526) Updated line-height of .text-xs and .text-sm.
  • (#562) Updated chevron icons to updated ones, made chevron smaller in price-box-bottom. Change html of price-box-bottom.
    • Breaking: Double chevron icons will appear in this component as chevron now is applied as background. Remove the <svg> element from the <div class="price-box-chevron"> container to fix.
  • (#561) Changed btn-group to flex-basis: 0 for consistent width no matter the btn content length
    • (0318275) Updated documentation.
    • Note: See the page for an update on the responsive flexbox rules.
  • (#548) changed lighter background color on personal menu to cloud #552
  • (#567) Patch/variables scss overhaul
  • (#565) Patch/radio cards update
    • Note: The behavior of buttons inside the radio-cards has been updated. Take a look at the example and update your local, responsive rules accordingly.
  • (#566) Improved the format and structure of the header component
    • .btn-login-logout now has a min-width of 85px.
  • (#578) Fixed .pagination-flex to have correct hover state.
  • (#588) Reformatted how spinners inside btn components work. Now works in all browsers.
    • Reformatted spinner inside btn components.
    • Spinner inside buttons now work in all browsers, and align themselves to the center of the button no matter its size.
    • Added buttons with spinners to button examples page.

Bugfixes

  • (#524) Fixes a bug in Safari and IE with wrong datepicker input height
  • (#527) Fixed HTML structure error on modal example page.
  • (#535) Fixed an issue where ul-checks list with list-md or list-lg had the wrong spacings.
  • (#545) Fixed issue where input-group-addon hover did not reflect the hover of the input field.
  • (#547) Arrow chevron for sticky-mode mobile pricing box disappears when clicked in Firefox
  • (#560) Fixed disabled states for different nav-links #549
  • (#559) Fixed issue where .card-img-* width smaller than card width caused border issues
  • (#569) Solves a bug with table buttons losing their styling, originating from #560
  • (75b04f0) Fixed faulty responsive behavior of .btn-group-stretch
  • (#576) Fixes css bug in IE11 where .btn-outline-secondary's box-shadow had a 1px gap between border and box-shadow
  • (#588) Fixed issue where spinner inside buttons did not work in IE.

Documentation

  • 78f3d9f Added dev server options to allow IE to preview the dev server, where it previously gave error due to webpack update
  • (#526) Added style tables for typography component
  • (#578) Patch/small fixes 530
    • Updated alert documentation paragraph on useage.
    • Added plus icon instead of plus text on button example.
    • Changed datepickers' to have a default date to not having to deal with constantly failed visual regression tests.
    • Added dropbox link to icons.
    • Typography documentation now includes paragraph that details that all bold text should be Intro Cond.
    • Fixed typo in README, formatting update in PR template.
  • (#580) Added callout to pie-charts to let know of d3
  • (#590) Added three sub pages to Forms component.
  • (#591) Patch/graphs charts fixes
    • Made graphs and charts page searchable.
    • Updated colors and color scales. Added text on these.
    • Added instruction texts on graphs with interactivitiy.
  • (#592) Patch/530 fixes yo
    • Updated changelogs.
    • Marked pagination-progress as deprecated.

Packaging

  • (#577) Updated stylelint and relevant loaders and deps. Corrected some errors.
  • (#579) Updated react components to match new react formatting. Added prop-types package, changed icon component.

This is a smaller release based on the 5.2.1 release, mainly intended for Öppna Sidorna, containing new icons and a few bugfixes with the only major change being #536, which changes the way buttons handle their arrows.

Summary of changes

This is a summary page for all changes that will ship together with v5.2.2

Features

  • (#536) Added support for btns with more than one line together with arrows
  • (#586) Added new icons for OS. Corrected stylelint errors. Disted.
    • icons: circeldiagram-40, computer-40, cup-40, id-40, sustainability-40

Changes

  • (#548) changed lighter background color on personal menu to cloud #552
  • (#589) Fixed and reformatted spinner inside btn components

Bugfixes

  • (#560) Fixed disabled states for different nav-links #549
  • (#559) Fixed issue where .card-img-* width smaller than card width caused border issues
  • (#569) Solves a bug with table buttons losing their styling, originating from #560

A bug (#524) sneaked its way into 5.2.0, which now has been corrected.
As a bonus, 5.2.1 also contains some last-minute additions to icons needed in projects, as well as updated colors in the .bg-diagonal-stripes-gray.

Summary of changes

This is a summary page for all changes that will ship together with v5.2.1

Features

  • (#534) Added new icons (user-happy-32, plus-10, contact-header-24) and improved chevron-32, disted icons and js

Changes

  • (#528) Adjusted colors of bg-diagonal-stripes-gray

Bugfixes

  • (#524) Fixes a bug in Safari and IE with wrong datepicker input heigh

LFUI 5.2.0 has landed!

Included in this release is a multitude of changes, all of which you can read more about in the summary below.

If you feel unsure on how to update your dependency, check out the README.

First off, do note that LFUI still hasn't updated its Boostrap v4-alpha dependency and thus still relies on alpha-5. As of this date no version bump has been scheduled, as we consider waiting for the beta release. If you want to add to the discussion related to this, check out the thread on the github repo. Because of this, it is important that you respect that the official bootstrap documentation is currently not 100% compatible with our version.
Also note that LFUI, despite some discussion as of late, still follows the same updating pattern as we've become accustomed to (for good and bad).

You can view the styleguide here

Highlighted changes and new components

  • Forms utilizing input-group-addons have changed padding in relation to the suffix or prefix placement of the addon. If the addon is on the left, the padding-left is 0, and vice versa for the right. This might cause some issue if you utilize addons with pictures or other backgrounds (most common example is the "registreringsnummer"-picture), that don't have the negative space styling. These "image-addons" can use the new .input-group-addon-img class to achieve proper styling. Read more about it in the updated Input Group section of the styleguide.
  • Our btn-outline-secondary (also reachable by using .btn-secondary now) has changed. They are now transparent with new hover and active behavior.
  • All arrows have been updated. The previous ones were not 100% crispy.
  • h6 now looks as it was intended to look from the beginning. For some reason, LFUI was diverging from the styleguide. If you have any h6s, you might want to look them over.
  • Our custom-made select element has been completely integrated with keyboard functionality, now working with proper, intended behavior as "normal" select-elements. The JS and HTML has changed, so that will have to be updated if you're not using the native one. Give the documentation a read, under Custom Forms.
  • Although deprecated for some time, we finally removed the support for automatic HTML5 form validation from our style sheets. We're no longer interfering with any validation, meaning you both have the freedom and obligation to fix it on your own. Yay!
  • The spinner is completed! No longer considered a work in progress, feel free to add some fresh LF-feel even during boring loading times.
  • The Datepicker should now open when focusing the input field and the button should be on the right side. Check out the styleguide if you're unsure how to achieve this.
  • Custom Forms and Links have some guidelines on spacings inside lists of them.

New components

  • Tags have been added. They are mainly for use in the styleguide, for now.
  • Legend boxes to be used in various graphical elements have been added to Utilities.
  • A whole lot of new icons, mainly coming from Öppna Sidornas implementations.
  • New collapse components and directives on toggling information, found in the new Collapse section.
  • Buttons with only arrows, to be used in different kinds of pagination views or carousel-like components.
  • The Popover Tooltip component is now finalized.
  • Spinner
  • Header and footer components to be used in Köptjänster

Styleguide features

  • Support for style tables detailing css properties of some components have been added, and 5.2.0 contains tables for a selected few components to begin with.
  • Support for navigating into older releases of LFUI inside the styleguide to check out how a component has changed between releases (this might be somewhat lacking for now, until our server allows us to transfer files to it with more ease).
  • A slightly better organization of some components. Links have received their own section, finally (I know you've been struggling to find them). Collapsible cards and other forms of collapsible components have been moved into a new Collapse section.
  • Grid and a new Responsive Layout section have been moved under "Layout", to mirror Bootstraps documentation. Responsive Layout contains instructions on what breakpoints LF recommends you use in your application, as well as some general responsive thoughts.

Coming up...

Next up will be improving our security and build. Creating a local npm registry and integrating css tests with a headless browser and continuous integration with something like Travis is long overdue. Also we'll be looking at our abilities to go modular with our css to support the large portion of React-JS developers.

As usual, never hesitate to file an issue with any form of request, question or bug report you might encounter.

LFUI 5.0.0 marks a major change in the project's structure, build and styleguide.

It has been a long time coming, but we believe this change will allow LFUI to grow, scale and function more properly in its future development.

How does this affect my app that's using LFUI?

5.0.0 is built on top of the 4.2.0 release, so there are no differences* to the actual output files. This means that if you are currently using the lf.js and/or lf.css from the LFUI dist-folder, this update does not affect you and you can update without any issues (which we recommend you do!).

If you, however, currently import files from LFUI manually in your build process you will have to look over the new structure and point your import paths correctly.

*apart from bugs resolved thanks to a more "correct" build

New project structure

The previous, component-based structure has been scrapped and replaced with a more Bootstrap-mirrored tree. The sass files are now all contained in the same folder and the same goes for our javascript. The components themselves are thusly not (even though they never were, only intended to) modular. The internal imports in each component have been removed (as per common sass-usage you can still import separate components' scss files of your own choice).

The tree looks as follows:

LFUI/
├── dist/
│   ├── lf.css
│   ├── lf.js
│   ├── icons.svg
│   └── Fonts/
└── src/
    ├── docs/
    │   └── Styleguide files
    ├── icon/
    ├── js/
    └── scss/

Build

Different from Bootstrap, we bundle and build our project with webpack and not grunt. The styleguide is now powered by React.js, which makes it much faster. We can now also export the styleguide properly, so expect to see the documentation on a web page not far in the future!

Styleguide development

Due to the changes described above the development methods have changed. If you are a developer and wish to contribute, read through the updated readme and/or the issue explaining the complete thing (in swedish) to get up to date with how you are supposed to work. Development does not require any understanding of webpack or react, as you can still edit scss-, js- and md-files just like before.

Styleguide improvements

  • Much faster!
  • You can now toggle and preview the html code in each example.
  • Ability to add details to each component. So far changelogs have been added, detailing in which previous releases the component has changed.
  • Ability to add separate "pages", such as examples, previews, wireframes, what-have-you.
  • You can now search for components/pages
  • You can now see all previous releases without having to visit the github page.
  • Ability to export a deployable styleguide with $ npm run build:styleguide
  • Linted css and js for prettier code!
  • Automatic reloading on changes in development
  • A good step in the direction of having a responsive, mobile-friendly styleguide
  • Updated readme with clearer instructions

Moving forward, development will resume in the 5.1.0 branch

Do not hesitate with any questions!

LFUI 4.2.0 is finally here!

Included in this release is a multitude of changes, all of which you can read more about in the summary below.

As a side note, Bootstrap v4 has released a new Alpha (they claim it is the last one before the beta), LFUI have however not migrated to Alpha-6 yet. This due to the major changes that was included in the version bump, and we have not yet thoroughly looked through the impact these changes will have on our applications.

Moving forward, soon after this release, the new styleguide will be released, in a separate version number. The new styleguide can be read about in more detail in this issue (in swedish), but the short story is that the styleguide has been completely rebuilt from the ground up to eliminate many of the bugs and restrictions the current styleguide imposed on us. The file structure has been redone to be more of a mirror image of Bootstrap's structure, which might cause your application using LFUI to loose track of some file paths. But, more of that in the coming, separate release. Important for you, however, is that the releases following this one will be on top of the new styleguide -- meaning that if you wish to rely and be up to date with LFUI in the future, upping your LFUI version will require you take these changes in consideration.
Now you know!

Known to most the latest alpha version of BS shipped 19th October and here at LFUI we should try to keep up with these releases as best we can, simply because when using the alpha of something so crucial to our entire build we should strive to include all the latest features and bugfixes.

This version does come with som major changes to the markup we've used so far, and will require som serious work in our applications to make sure nothing breaks in the conversion.

I decided to compile a simple checklist when migrating to make sure nothing changes in unwanted ways:

Grid updates

"The .container behaviors have changed slightly in Alpha 5. We now set the width of each container alongside a max-width: 100%;", "The sm tier’s container is now smaller than it’s viewport dimensions and the lg tier has changed from 940px to 960px for grid columns that more cleanly by 12."

  • Take a look at your container wrappers and make sure they are the correct width.
  • Take a look at your responsiveness across the application and make sure the behavior is intact, specifically the affected tiers specified above.
  • Take a look at your custom media queries in your application and make sure they follow the new breakpoints.

    Utilities overhaul

  • All utility classes of type (e.g) m-x-*, p-x-*, m-a-* etc are now mx-*, px-* and ma-*. These will need to be replaced accordingly across your entire application
  • (e.g) pull-*-right and pull-*-left are now float-*-right and float-*-left. These will need to be replaced accordingly across your entire application.

    Navbar updates

  • The navbar has received some updates. Although I am not sure how this will specifically affect our navbars I recommend taking a closer look at them, where they are used.

Good luck!

LFUI v3.0.0 is finally released!

Due to the multitude of changes, features and fixes a detailed list of these will not be specified.
From now on we push towards 3.1.0. Any important hotfixes of the release can be applied to hotfix versions of 3.0.0 that will be tagged 3.0.1, 3.0.2 and so forth.
